required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Feasibility Evaluation of a Self-guided Digital Tool for Problematic Alcohol Use
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility Evaluation of a Self-guided Digital Tool for Problematic Alcohol Use

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the feasibility of a new monitored self-guided digital intervention based on an alcohol diary and techniques from cognitive behavioral therapy and relapse prevention. The participants will be adults with problematic alcohol use. An uncontrolled trial will explore participant's usability and treatment credibility ratings, behavioural engagement and preliminary effects on alcohol use.

primary_outcome.measure: Standardized drinks per week (based on Time Line Follow Back)
primary_outcome.description: Changes in standardized drinks per week (using Time Line Follow Back)

primary_outcome.measure: Heavy drinking days (based on Time Line Follow Back)
primary_outcome.description: Changes in number of heavy drinking days (defined as ≥ 5 (men) or ≥ 4 (women) standardized drinks on a single day, using the Time Line Follow Back)

secondary_outcome.measure: Standardized drinks per week (based on Time Line Follow Back)
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in standardized drinks per week (using Time Line Follow Back)

secondary_outcome.measure: Heavy drinking days (based on Time Line Follow Back)
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in number of heavy drinking days (defined as ≥ 5 (men) or ≥ 4 (women) standardized drinks on a single day, using the Time Line Follow Back)
System Usability Scale (SUS), score range 0-100, higher is better.
Credibility/Expectancy questionnaire, score range 0-50, higher is better
Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test (AUDIT), score range 0-40, lower is better
Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test (AUDIT), score range 0-40, lower is better

secondary_outcome.measure: Brunnsviken Brief Quality of Life Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Brunnsviken Brief Quality of Life Scale (BBQ), score range 0-96, higher is better

secondary_outcome.measure: Brunnsviken Brief Quality of Life Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Brunnsviken Brief Quality of Life Scale (BBQ), score range 0-96, higher is better
Penn Alcohol Craving Scale (PACS), score range 0-30, lower is better
Penn Alcohol Craving Scale (PACS), score range 0-30, lower is better
Patient Health Questionnaire 9 (PHQ-9), score range 0-27, lower is better
Patient Health Questionnaire 9 (PHQ-9), score range 0-27, lower is better
Generalized Anxiety Disorder 7 (GAD-7), score range 0-21, lower is better
Generalized Anxiety Disorder 7 (GAD-7), score range 0-21, lower is better

other_outcome.measure: Telephone interview on perceptions of intervention

arm_group.arm_group_label: Self-guided Digital Tool for Problematic Alcohol Use
arm_group.description: Self-guided Digital Tool for Problematic Alcohol Use during 8 weeks with clinical telephone interviews pre ant post intervention.

intervention.intervention_name: Self-guided Digital Tool for Problematic Alcohol Use
intervention.arm_group_label: Self-guided Digital Tool for Problematic Alcohol Use

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. ≥ 18 years of age
2. Access to internet
3. ≥8 points for men and ≥6 points for women on Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test (AUDIT)
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Insufficient knowledge of the Swedish language
2. Difficulties reading or writing related to a digital intervention.
3. Other ongoing psychological treatment with a content similar to that in the current study (problematic alcohol use).
4. High suicide risk based on telephone assessment.
5. Other urgent need for more intensive psychiatric care, or addiction care services, based on telephone assessment.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Licensed clinical psychologist, Principal investigator, PhD
